attributes.action: Ensure healthcare practitioners have guidance on gambling
attributes.additional_details:
The last well-designed gambling prevalence survey in Great Britain, BGPS 2010, found that 8.5% of adults (4.5m using a 2020 population) were vulnerable gamblers. 

From 2010 to 2019, the gross gambling yield excluding lotteries has grown by 103% to a value of £10.7bn, due to rapid advances in game addictiveness, ad penetration and accessibility of online gambling products. Meanwhile, the percentage of adults who think gambling is fair has fallen from 49.4% to an all-time low of 29%.
attributes.background:
It is estimated that more than 1m healthy years of life are lost with adult vulnerable gambling every year.
Medical professionals are trained to ask questions around smoking & drug use but gambling is largely omitted out of training and practice.
There are currently 0 NICE guidelines on gambling.

rejection.details:
NICE are currently working on clinicial guidance. Priortisation of gambling advice would be a matter for NICE rather than the Government or Parliament.  You can find updates here:

https://www.nice.org.uk/guidance/proposed/gid-qs10099

You could start a petition calling for the Government to fund more work to raise awareness of gambling for healthcare workers, if that's something you'd like to see happen.
